rawDocs.text: i
Anon.

For many centuries 
                        after
                        afte
                      Britain became an island "
the historian says, "the untamed forest was king."

He goes on to say that amillions of
                     birds, perched on

the top of those matted branches, sang their
                     choruses.

Only the skin clad
                     hunters in the clearings heard the song.

The tree 
                        had
                        ha 
                      to be felled; and a hut made
                     from its
branches , before the human voice sang too.
By a bank as I lay

Musing myself alone, j
              hey ho!
A birdes voice
Did me rejoice,
Snging before the day,
and me thought in her lay
She said, winter was past, hey ho!
The first songs are out of door songs; because there
was no comfort indoors, little light, and no books.

The voice that 
                        brok
                        broke
                      the 
                        silnec
                        silence
                      of the forests was like
                     a

birds voice, singing out of doors. It was
                     the voice of

Anon. He
                     had no comfort indoors, little light

and no books. He had 
                        n
                        no
                      name. Some one heard the song

and 
                        rmember d
                        remembered
                      it, for it was later
                     written down. TheThusthe singer

had his audience thus; but the
                     audience was so little

interested in his name that he never thought to
                     give it.

And The audience took part too
                     in the song. "Terly, terlow"

they sang: and "By,
                     by lullay" filling in 
                        th 
                        the
                      pause,

helping out the larger
                     meaning.[Anon sings because spring has

me; or winter is gone; 
                        b cause
                        because
                      he loves; because he
is hungry; or lustful; or merry.] Everybody shares the
For Sissy Miller
She comes.
Scene.
their diaries
P R. M.
& Anon sung

emition
              emotion
            ; and knows the old story of the Nut brown maid.
Anon is sometimes woman; sometimes man; he is the
He sees of leaves them because
common voice; Anon goes round the country singing.
He has a very quick eye, connected, for the eye is the
youthful sense, rather with the body than the mind.
Anon Hehas no house. He lives a roaming out of door
country life, going from village to village,

stopping 
            
              a
              at
             the back door ,oftener than at the front,

going 
            
              alojg
              along
             grassy paths over the hills. | By choosing a view

carefully to shut out a chimney or a
            
              bungalwo
              bungalow
            , we can still

see, in 
            
              osome
              some
            , or up on some down, what Anon saw.

the bird 
            
              ha unted
              haunted
             
            
              red
              reed
             whispering fen; the down covered
with turf; and the scar, long healed, over the downhill
along which Anon came when he made his journeys.

He was garrulous; 
            
              looe
              loose
             lipped; taking from other peoples
mouths here a story, there a stanza. But now and again he

as we 
            
              acll
              call
             it, an artist; the words are complete; the song
finished.
